column1: back of a length at off stump, skids on nicely and meets an angled bat in front of off stump
good length, wide outside off stump, lets it go as it deviates away slightly after pitching
good length at off stump, defended to point off the front foot
back of a length outside off, climbs on him as he pokes away from the body, beaten
full at middle stump, gets a short stride across and drives to mid-on on the up
bouncer angles in sharply at his shoulder and he ducks under it, smashes into the keeper's gloves
full and angled in at leg stump, offers the full face and pushes to mid-on
pulls the length back a little, but the line is the same, as is the angle. Stands tall and flicks it fine
back of a length at the pads, glanced to fine leg
beauty. Back of  a length in the corridor, another one climbs on him. This time he's on the back foot and plays inside the line to be beaten on the outside edge
good length, in the corridor, draws him forward and takes the inside edge and hits him hard on the pads
nearly. Good length, angled in at off stump, he drives on the up and hits it aerially towards mid-on, who dives forward as it just falls short of him
good length, shaping away slightly from off stump, feet are rooted as he pushes at this and gets a thick outside edge between backward point and cover
good length in the corridor, pitches, nips back and beats the inside edge as it flies over the stumps
bouncer rises sharply from a middle stump line, he sways backwards and lets it go
good length at middle stump, rides the bounce, plays slightly across and pushes it past square leg's right
back of a length outside off, shapes up nicely, stays still, not too much feet but this pitch is true. He hangs ack and slashes on the up, Duminy cuts it off at point
good length at off stump, front foot defence
good length in the corridor, pushes forward and defends with soft hands
full outside off, extends the arms and goes inside-out over extra cover. Not quite timed to perfection, but he'll take that to get off the mark
full toss at leg stump, driven to mid-on
back of a length at off stump, nips back and thumps him on the back leg as he pushes forward

Was there an edge? There's a bit of a sound as Guptill loses patience and goes across the line. It flies through to de Kock who is the only one appealing after taking it down the leg side...they contemplate the review, but no one was certain
bouncer is thumped in well short and de Kock rises high to get one hand on it and save the four
back of a length at middle, hurries through to him before he can balance himself to nail the hook shot and it's a thick under-edge down to fine leg
full toss, angled in at the pad, flicked straight to square leg
another well directed bouncer, he doesn't even think of offering a shot. They're flying through here

gone! A sustained spell of top-class fast bowling has paid off. Guptill walks down the leg side, exposes all his stumps, and yorks himself. He's the played inside the line to yet another one and this time it means the stumps are shattered. He looked out of sorts today
good length, at off stump, pushes back and defends into the leg side
yorker at off stump, gets his bat down just in time as it shapes away at the very last moment, outside edge flies to third man. Rabada is turning it on here
142 kph, back of a length, climbs sharply at his ribs, but he gets on top of the bounce and tucks it down to fine leg
good length, angled in at the pads, gets behind the line and pushes into the leg side
good length in the corridor, solidly behind it and gets good timing on his push back to the bowler who catches it on the bounce
good length, in the corridor, forward defence right under his eyes
full at middle stump, waits for it, keeps his shape, and caresses it through the open midwicket region
full outside off, tempts him and he takes the bait. Loses shape, goes away from the body with this drive, gets an inside edge onto pad
good length at middle stump, defended to square leg
back of a length, angled down the leg side, flies past the attempted leg glance
shot! Good length outside off, bounces up nicely on this pitch and he slaps it on the up, but Miller dives to his left and offers no reward for a beautiful looking shot
back of a length, angled into the corridor, tries to cut this, but it's too close to him and far too quick. Squeezed out to point.
back of a length outside off, this time he hangs back and uses the pace off the pitch to get it past point's left and this is a small ground with a fast pitch - no one is cutting that off
good length at middle stump, gets behind the line and pushes it to mid-on
good length at middle stump, pushed back towards the non-striker, Rabada gets across, picks up and has a shy. Brownlie scrambles to get back
good length, slides down the leg side
back of a length in the corridor, back foot defence
back of a length, angled in to the thigh guard, which it catches as he attempts a glance
good length at off stump, defended on the up to mid-off
back of a length at middle stump, whipped nicely, straight to square leg
good length outside off, pushed on the up to mid-off
good length outside off, offers the full face and punches to mid-on
good length, angled in at middle stump, flicks it to fine leg
full at leg stump, times the drive nicely, but straight to mid-on again
bouncer at middle stump, hurries to duck under this
back of a length at off stump, pushed tentatively to mid-off, where AB runs in hard and has a shy at the striker's end, but it was a good call and good running
back of a length outside, times a back foot slice nicely, point dives to cut it off
full at the pads, shapes to flick it through midwicket but has to adjust last minute to keep his balance and push it to mid-on
yorker at the boots, pushed to square leg
back of a length outside off, could've played a pull across the line on most other pitches, but it's a top edge on this pitch that flies over the umpire, safely
back of a length at off stump, covers the line and opens the face last minute to run it down to third man
good fielding. Gets good bat on this flick shot, but Phehlukwayo dives low to his right at square leg
classy shot. Back of a length at middle, this time he's balanced and puts in a short stride to whip it on the up over midwicket
short and wide, punched straight to covers. He'll be disappointed to have no runs for that ball
148 kph, back of a length at middle, rises sharply and hits the bat before he can control the pull shot. Gets it high on the bat and just over square leg who runs back and cuts it off
good length, floated up at off stump, goes forward and pushes back to the bowler
full at middle stump, pushed to long-on
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
good length at off stump, not quite to the pitch as he tries to drive it to long-on, gap between bat and pad, thick edge onto pad
good length outside off, googly, front foot defence

That should be out...he's walking back, is Williamson. Good length at middle stump, goes back and pushes it to AB's right at midwicket. He dives, and releases the ball quickly after slight hesitation from the batsmen. Williamson slides his bat, it gets stuck in the ground and de Kock catches the throw low to his left and whips the bails off. He would've been short anyway. There wasn't a run there, but Brownlie had seen his partner take off and didn't say no
back of a length outside off, punched to covers off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length, angled in at off stump, goes across the line to whip it through midwicket, gets struck right in front and there's no overturning that
good length outside off, defended into the off side with an angled bat
good length at off stump, gets behind it and defends into he off side with a half-stride
good length outside off, defended into the gully region
good length at the pads, nervous push at it, runs to short fine
googly, tossed up outside off, driven sweetly to deep cover
good length at middle stump, pushes right forward and bunts it back to the bowler
googly, good length outside off, picks it and gets behind it to defend into the off side
good length at off stump, another googly, tries to work it to long-on, can't get enough bat
good length at off stump, forward defence
back of a length outside off, stride across the stumps, drives on the up, well away from the body, beaten
full at middle stump, watches it closely and punches a delightful on-drive past the mid-on fielder
full at the pads, hurries to bring his bat down to tickle it to fine leg
back of a length outside off, pushed into the off side
good length at leg stump, wants to turn this with the angle through square, but he's looking at the destination, not the ball, raps into the pads
good length outside off, slight angle in, pushes in front of his body to turn it into the leg side, gets an inside edge onto pad
good length at middle stump, defended towards midwicket
good length at middle stump, forward defence to midwicket
good length at middle, gives him the charge and pushes it to mid-on
full at middle stump, driven to mid-on
googly, good length outside off, whips it into the leg side, straight to midwicket
good length at off stump, eager push into the off side to try and steal a run, but it's straight at covers
back of a length outside off stump, cramps him for room and hits it high on the bat on the attempted back foot punch that is jammed into the ground
full at the pads, pushed with soft hands to square leg's left
good length at middle, puts in a half-stride and swipes across the line. Caught in front of the stumps, but that was going over
back of a length at middle, rocks back in a hurry and keeps the pull shot down to get off the mark
good length at off stump, driven on the up to cover

oh dear. Awful shot. Just awful from a senior batsman at 51 for 3. Good length, angled in at off stump and Phehlukwayo has suckered another one in to playing across the line and look for the midwicket boundary. This should be crashing into off-and-middle at a reasonable height.
slider, full at middle stump, catches the thick inside edge before he knows it had arrived
googly, good length at off stump, defended solidly off the front foot
googly, good length outside off, forward defence
googly, good length at off stump, goes back and defends late off the back foot
back of a length outside off, spins back in slightly and erases the room for the cut and he jams it to point
good length outside off stump, defended back to the bowler
short of good length, punched off the backfoot past the diving cover fielder
length ball, bowls it with a cross seam as the ball lands outside off and it is defended into the off side from the crease. Not much feet from Neesham
fuller and holding its line on off, Neesham crunches a drive off the front foot to mid-off

full and coming on very straight, Neesham tries to whip across the line and force it to the leg side but the bat turns in his hands as he plays it and it goes off the inside part of the blade to behind square on the leg side
fullish length ball and pushed across outside off, stays in the crease and opens the face of his bat to steer it through third man, backward point runs across and fields it
fuller and outside off and Neesham presses forward and leans into a drive. The ball goes to the left of the cover fielder who dives but the ball goes from beneath him and into the cover boundary
short ball, swivels around and pulls to deep square leg where there is a fielder guarding the boundary
too full, a full toss in fact, Neesham just has to press forward and ease into the drive to get it past the bowler and into the straight boundary
very full ball outside off, driven firmly but straight to the bowler
good length ball and angling in, defended with the angle to short midwicket
closes the face of his bat as he drills this fullish ball to mid-on
full again and on the pads and this time Neesham clips it off the pads and picks the gap well as he splits midwicket and mid-on

fullish length ball, presents a straight bat and drills it straight down the ground, past the outstretched hands of the bowler. Mid-off and mid-on converge and mid-on dives to his right but cannot get to it

short ball, did not get up as much as the batsman expected it to. Ronchi wants to arch back and let it go but because the bounce is low, he inadvertently gets a glove to it and it carries to the wicketkeeper. Should have dropped the wrists there. Not unplayable bounce but not the best way to deal with it
beautifully bowled. Teases him with a fullish length ball by angling it across on off and the batsman makes a late decision to leave it
left alone outside off
short of a length on leg and angling away, stands tall inside the crease and defends with a straight bat
good length ball, angling across on off, blocked into the off side
short of a length ball, shifts back into the crease and pulls it into the deep midwicket boundary. Deep square leg runs across but cannot get to it
short of a length and some width on offer outside off this time, opens the bat face and steers it to backward point
good length ball, defends with an open bat face into the off side

harmless half-volley at 120.7kph, lot of time for Neesham who gets on top of it and lofts it straight down the ground. Bat swoops down and makes a lovely angle as he holds his pose after playing the shot. Shot of the day so far
good length ball, pushed across, defends it late to backward point
defended into the off side
fuller and angling across, nicely pitched up to tempt him into a drive in the corridor and Santner gets beaten as he obliges
change-up from Morris. Bouncer but too much bounce on it and it is called a wide as the batsman arches back and lets it go
fuller and angling away on the corridor again, left alone in the channel outside off
full and angling across again, Santner does not bother going after it
shouts of catch it. Full and too wide outside off, Santner chases it and does not keep the push along the ground. But he gets it well wide of the fielder at cover
good length on off, defended to mid-off from the crease
opens the bat face and plays this late to point
full and outside off, driven crisply along the ground to mid-off
good length outside off, chooses to stay in the crease and defends it hard into the ground

Review for catch taken by South Africa. That has gone off the top edge to the helmet and to the fielder. It was a short ball and Neesham was looking to pull it. But the ball gets big on him and goes off the top edge, hits him on the helmet and goes to the fielder at point. On-field call reversed
very full outside off, jams the bat down squeezed it out behind square into the leg side. Does not really control it, brings the bat down quickly and gets an inside edge
very full ball, yorker length on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
fuller ball, presses forward and chips it over between cover and extra cover. Not enough on the shot for the ball to go all the way to the boundary as extra cover runs back and stops it
full and outside off, comes forward and drives to mid-off
good length on off, defended off the front foot into the off side
full and angling away, cross-seam delivery, tries to heave it away and gets a thick outside edge that goes in the air and drops short of third man
blocked into the off side
full and angling in, clipped off the pads to midwicket
fuller length ball, defended from the crease
left alone in the channel outside off
short ball, ducked under as the ball angles down leg

dropped. Extremely tough chane, though. Almost unfair to call that a dropped chance, although it would hve been spectacular had he taken. Fuller ball, outside off, de Grandhomme's bat face closes as he drills it to the right of the bowler. Does not keep it along the ground and Rabada stretches out his right hand and gets his hand to it. Cannot hold on to it as tumbles down on the follow-through
angling down the leg side, glances it fine and the ball goes into the fine leg boundary
tucked to deep midwicket for a single
good length ball, defended back to the bowler
short of a length outside off, carves it out to point from the crease, straight to the man there
full and outside off, presses forward and drives it gently to mid-off
short ball, swivels around and pulls it to deep square leg
good length on off, sticks his bat out and gets beaten. He was trying to open the face late but cannot succeed in making contact
left alone in the channel outside off
nicely flighted ball, de Grandhomme come sforward and crunches a drive straight to cover
closes the bat face as he drives this pitched up ball from outside off and drags it down to long-on. It was the wrong'un and picked up well by the batsman

dropped. Comes forward and chips this full toss in the air and just over Tahir who puts his right hand up but cannot hold on to the catch. That was a lot simpler than the earlier chance that went down, off Rabada
gets an outside edge this time and the ball drops short of Amla at first slip
punched off the backfoot to point
could have been a run out., Fuller ball, Santner drops it in front of cover and takes off for a single. Miller fails to pick it up cleanly and the fumble saves the batsman
full and outside off, eases into a drive to covers
closes the bat face as he drives this fuller ball to mid-on from outside off
good length on off, defended with a straight bat and the bowler springs across on the follow-through to pick it up

Run out chance, missed again. full ball, tucked to midwicket and sets off for a very quick single.  Miller at midwicket this time make s agood stop by diving, but a direct hit was needed at the keeper's end which he does not manage
full and outside off, driven to long-off
flighted on off, Santner gets a good stride forward and defends it back to Tahir
backs away to make room and punches it to the off side. That was the slider and Santner does not pick it
pushes this to point off the front foot

yes-and-no, safe in the end. Comes forward and pushes it to mid-on and takes off for the single but de Grandhomme is not interested and sends Santner back after he is quite some distance down. Gets back
driven off the front foot to long-off
pitched up on off, eased into the off side off the front foot and cover dives to prevent the single
short of a length outside off, punched down to long-off
length ball, punched to long-on
fullish length ball, stays in the crease and tucks this into the leg side
nicely angling away from the left-hander form the fullish length, blocked to mid-off who is slightly up
good length, defended to silly mid-off from the crease
tucked to midwicket who does not make a clean stop but Santner denies the single nonetheless as mid-on is backing up
stays back though it is full in length and manages to keep it out on the leg side
whipped from the crease to mid-on
pitched up on the stumps, driven down to long-on
flat and full on the stumps, gets forward and blocks into the off side
chips this over the bowler's head and well over Tahir as the ball goes to long-on where Rabada runs across, dives and throws the ball to Duminy after picking it up
comes down the track and drives this to long-off
fuller ball, clipped away from outside off to long-on
short of good length ball, stays back in the crease and defends it back to the bowler
good length ball, closes the face of his bat and plays it on to his pads as the ball rolls away into the off side
fuller ball, picked up off the pads and lofted through the midwicket region. No one there or protecting the boundary and the ball sails into the boundary
length ball, defended off the front foot into the covers region
slashes at the sight of width but is beaten by pace and the ball bounces more than he would have liked as he gets beaten
fuller ball on the pads, inside-edges the attempted tuck to the pads and the ball goes to behind square
full and angling across on the fifth-stump channel, chops the defence hard into the turf
fuller and outside off, comes forward and blocks into covers
short of a length, pulled hard from the crease by Santner to deep midwicket
full and on leg stump line, comes forward and quietly turns it away to midwicket
full and angled across, defended into the off side off the front foot
short ball, ducked under
tries to punch this one off the backfoot with a half-angled bat but there is not enough room to free his arms and he chops it hard into the ground
uses his feet and gets it over mid-off. Length ball, de Grandhomme comes down a step and launches it over the outstretched hands of the fielder at mid-off with an angled bat
worked to long-on for a comfortable single
full and outside off, drilled down to long-off
short ball, sitting up nicely and coming at a nice pace, pulled extremely hard as he swivels around and the ball goes straight to the fielder guarding the deep fine leg boundary
back of a length, angled into the pads, inside edge into the thigh guard and to the right of midwicket
112 kph, back of a length outside off, hangs back and slaps it past midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched on the bounce to point who makes de Grandhomme dive to get back into the crease at the non-strikers
back of a length outside off, punched towards mid-off, extra cover gets across and just about misses the gather as he dives to have a shy, de Grandhomme has to make another despairing dive
back of a length at middle stump, punched off the back foot towards long-on, midwicket dives and cuts it off

oh South Africa. That's four consecutive balls of world class fielding. Although it was pretty poor running and match awareness from Santner. Good length outside off, opens the face and thinks he's got it past Duminy at point. He's not even looking as he takes off for the run to suddenly see his partner send him back. By the time he's looked around to see what's happened, Duminy has got up from his dive and broken the stumps off a direct hit
full at off stump, thumps it hard to mid-off, takes off slowly, realizes it's AB at mid-off, scrambles and just about makes the crease as he misses the stumps
bouncer outside off, Southee arches backwards and tries to ramp it over first slip
good length at middle stump, gets the bat down late on his defence, bumps into the ground and bounces over the stumps
short and wide, goes for the cut, mistimes it straight to point
back of a length at off stump, hurries onto him and he inside-edges into the pitch on the attempted back foot punch
back of a length outside off, the off side isn't working for him, so he swivels and slots this easily over the deep square leg fielder
full outside off, driven to long-off
full and into the blockhole at leg stump, dug out into the off side

flighted at a good length outside off, opens up his stance. It's spinning away from him all the time, he's not to the pitch but goes across with the slog sweep anyway. Gets a top edge, it flies high, no one wants to deny Tahir the opportunity to take this catch and he does so comfortably, a couple of yards to the left of where his run-up starts
full at leg stump, drives towards long-on, but midwicket gets across to cut it
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover

googly, back of a length at middle stump, spins back in sharply. He tries to shovel it fine. Did that get bat? It might have as it brushed the thigh guard and leg slip took it on the bounce, low to his left
bouncer at off stump, takes on the hook and misses
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full at off stump, walks across and thumps a drive to long-on
back of a length down the leg side, goes for the glance again, it brushes off his thigh guard again, but this time it flies past de Kock's outstretched left hand
back of a length at middle stump, back foot defence
bouncer in the corridor, he goes well low and looks at the floor as he ducks this
good length at middle stump, goes back and turns it to midwicket

slider slightly outside off stump, good length. Goes on the back foot and tries to punch it into the leg side, catches it on the pad. He's right back in the crease and is caught on the pad. Umpire raises the finger....and they haven't reviewed. It looked like he was struck outside the line. They had a long discussion, but chose not to review. Oh dear, replays show that hit outside off and was missing the wickets.
full outside off, driven back to the bowler
good length at off stump, spins away, pushes at it away from the body
flighted full outside off, makes a million trigger movements, walks across and distorts completely as he defends it
full outside off, follows the line and lets it go, almost falling over
full at leg stump, drills it down to long-on and doesn't have any intention of exposing Boult to the strike
back of a length outside off, hangs back and goes for the pull, mistimed, straight to midwicket who is on the edge of the circle
slower ball, good length outside off, drops it towards the gully area and reluctantly goes through for the single
slower yorker at leg stump, backs away enormously, blocks it and then walks back towards the stumps to get into great poise
139 kph, backs away and blocks out another yorker at leg stump
bouncer at middle stump, twists and swivels awkwardly and fends this towards square leg but it drops short of the fielder

good length outside off, spins away as he steps out and doesn't get to the pitch of the ball. Throws his hands out at it, slices high towards sweeper cover wher ePhehlukwayo runs in and doesn't attempt the catch. apologises to the bowler, says he lost it in the crowd
full at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
good length at off stump, waits for it and tries to push it past slip, but Amla gets down fast and stops it
good length at off stump, gets forward and with a real flourish of the bat, plays the forward defence
full googly outside off, goes for the reverse sweep, catches it on the pad well outside off
full at middle stump, gets forward and finally gets a drive right out of the middle, but the No. 11 prejudice means he will not get a run for it

back of a length outside off, walks across and tries to slog this over midwicket, beaten and it goes through to the keeper....who has appealed and asked for a review as the umpire shook his head. And it looks like a good review. Snicko and hotspot indicate there was a tiny feather at the bottom of the bat
defended into the off side
loopy fuller ball, sliding in and trapping de Kock in front as he misses the flick. But he was getting the front leg towards leg stump anf the angle anyway would have taken it down leg
tucked behind square
comes down the track but the inward drift is sharp and h gets hit on the pad
mistimes a sweep and the ball is in the air. Shouts of catch but it lands well short of the deep midwicket fielder
shifts back and defends this length ball off the inside edge into the leg side
short of a length and some width on offer outside off, cut but cannot beat the in-field

pitches it up but there is room outside off again and de Kock sticks his bat out. Plays a long way awat from the body but he was not trying to hit it too hard, just leans into the drive through covers
fullish length outside off, punched firmly off the front foot into the off side
full and angling down the keg side, clipped off the pads to deep midwicket
fuller ball, clipped off the pads to midwicket who runs in and dives forward to field it
shuffles across to this length ball that is pushed across and is left alone

de Kock in some hurry here and he pays the price. Tries to take on the spinner and comes down the track. Lofts it over mid-off but there is some turn which means he cannot find the middle of the bat and the ball goes down the throat of long-off
defended into the off side
dabs it through midwicket
comes forward to defend and the ball goes off the inside part of the bat to the leg side
fullish length ball at pace - 100.2kph, hurriedly defends from the crease to the leg side
blocked to the off side from the crease

oh, glorious cover drive. No stopping that. Full and enough width on offer outside off. Amla does not really lean forward, just stays in the crease but makes up for the lack of feet movement with impeccable timing, crunches it through extra cover. Wide of Williamson and the ball easily beats him as he gives it a chase
short of a length, around a set of stumps outside off and holding its line. Amla shuffles across and protects the off stump before shouldering arms
shifts back to this back of a length ball and tucks it with the angle to the leg side
back of a length and angling down leg, good movement into the right-hander but it is sharp enough to take it down the leg side
this time it comes on straighter, it's a similar length, short of good length, and Amla is pushed back as he defends off the backfoot after riding the bounce
ooh, nice, sharp movement into the right-hander from outside off. It is fired well outside off and Amla is sure of his off-stump, so he lets it go
goes for a feeble pull shot but it is too full and does not sit up enough, so he can only dab it off the bottom part of the bat to the leg side
fuller and straighter, blocked straight down the pitch
full and angling in on middle, du Plessis defends with a straight bat to point
short of a length and outside off, stands tall and gets on top of the bounce before punching it firmly to point off the backfoot
swings wildly at this wide delivery outside off. But there is some good late movement away from the right-hander on that occasion and it results in the batsman getting beaten
opens the face of his bat to steer this delivery down to third man to finally get off the mark, off his ninth delivery
fuller ball outside off, du Plessis chases it but there is some late movement again and he ends up getting beaten as he front hand comes off
length ball, defended back down the pitch
short ball, thinks of going for a pull but seeing how wide it is, changes his mind and keeps the bat down
good, late swing into the right-hander but du Plessis knows where his off-stump is and trusts the angle to let it go
short ball, coming on at a nice height again and this time du Plessis goes with the pull shot as the ball is pulled through square leg
full and wide outside off, no late movement. Amla skips across to cover off-stump and lets it go
left alone outside off.
full and moving away outside off, du Plessis comes forward and pushes it down the ground
full and on the pads, clipped off them to midwicket where the fielder makes a save after flinging himself to his right
full and just outside off, holding its line, du Plessis strides forward and crunches a drive to mid-off
fullish length ball, gets it to move away late, du Plessis wants to drive but it starts to swing away and he withdraws
diving save by Santner at cover-point. Du Plessis stretches out and crunches a drive. Santner does not stop it entirey which allows them the single but he saved what would have been a boundary
cutting back in sharply from the short of a length region and strikes du Plessis on the body as it misses his attempted flick. He tumbles over. Sharp movement there
back of a length, nudged to the leg side from the crease
fuller and outside off, blocked to covers
guides it with the inward angle to mid-on after shifting across in the crease

fuller ball, Amla expects it to come in to him more and closes the face of his bat as he tries to clip it into the leg side. But the ball is slightly straighter and opens him up, gets the leading edge and goes to third man
full and outside off, leans forward and crunches a drive that beats the dive of Kane Williamson at extra cover
shifts across to protect the off-stump and leaves this ball, tailing away from him, alone. This is a probing spell of swing bowling
fuller and outside off, not as much movement this time and Amla gets right across to defend with bat close to pad into the covers region
full and straight on off and middle and Amla shifts back to use the depth of the crease and defend it back to the bowler

short ball, swivels around and pulls it, does not get hold of it and the ball goes off the top edge. Fielded at the square leg region and Boult picks it up and fires a throw at the keeper's end as they charge back for the second. It's slightly wide and Ronchi collects it cleanly but they make it back
good length, slightly straightening on middle, pushed into the leg side
back of a length and angling in, du Plessis was looking to punch it through the off side but does not account for the movement and gets hit hard on the inside thigh. Yikes, must have stung horribly
back of a length outside off, defended firmly off the backfoot towards mid-off
length ball, pushed from the crease and straight to mid-off
short ball, the ball goes outside off and called a wide as it is outside the crease
short and wide again and left alone
short ball, sitting up nicely and beats the short midwicket fielder as he gets it wide of him as the ball goes screaming into the boundary

and this one's trickled down fine. Off the pad, actually. Full and fired in on the pads and du Plessis tries to glance it fine and the ball goes off the pad instead, beats the wicketkeeper and is wide enough of fine who is inside the circle
full and on the pads, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
good length and outside off, jumps back inside the crease and defends it into the off side
oh, beautifully done. Good length on or around off and draws Amla into a forward push. Gets it to nip away late and Amla is opened up late as the ball beats the outside edge
not much movement this time, it's a fuller ball and it is driven firmly to extra cover
tries to trickle it fine off the pads and the ball misses the bat as it goes down the leg side to the keeper
full ball, driven to mid-off
opened up slightly as he pokes at this length ball outside off and gets beaten
fuller ball on the stumps, driven down the pitch

comes down the track and makes room as he looks to go inside-out and ends up exposing all three stumps. Does not place it where he would have liked to and the ball goes to the left of the bowler who stretches out
sprayed down the leg side
swings wildly at this fuller ball outside off and gets comprehensively beaten
gone. Straight to cover. Full and wide outside off again and Amla lays into a cover drive. Hit extremely hard except that it goes straight into the hands of the fielder at cover
fullish ball, presses forward and drives it to mid-off
shifts back and moves away and the ball follows him as it cuts back in and raps him on the pad. Would have gone down leg
short of a length and outside off, stays in the crease and stabs it to point
fuller ball, backs away slightly and drives but cannot beat cover
good length ball outside off, knocks it to mid-on with a straight bat
short of a length and angling in, tries to tuck it fine and wears it on the pad instead
width on offer outside off, Duminy sticks his bat out and stabs it to point
angled in on the pads, glances it fine and Jeetan Patel slides across, picks up the ball and drops it down, but has done well to stop the boundary
dabs this one into the leg side
short of good length, opens the face of his bat and steers it to square third man
comes forward to drill this straight down the ground but there is sharp movement in to Duminy who gets an inside edge to midwicket
fuller ball, pushes it along the ground to mid-off
short of a length on off, steered to backward point
short and width on offer outside off, slapped in front of square, between cover-point and point
tries to slap this wide delivery away but cannot make contact as the ball does not come at a comfortable bounce
shuffles across to this length ball and drops it into the off side with soft hands
short of a length outside off, defended to covers
full and wide, reaches out for it and skews it off a healthy outside edge to third man
sprays it down the leg side and called a wide
pitched up on middle and leg, pushed off the front foot back to the bowler

Duminy has picked out cover. Nicely done by Jeetan, pitches it right up and gets it to spin away from Duminy who goes for a drive but skews it off the outside part of the bat and sends it straight into the hands of cover
good length at off stump, defends off the back foot
good length at off, straightens on him and he has to open the face of the bat to adjust his forward defence
full at middle stump, looks to drive through midwicket, gets a thick inside edge that rolls past short fine for four
full outside off, goes for the reverse sweep and misses, loud appeal from the bowler but even he knew it wasn't out
good length, fired down the leg side
shot. Full at middle stump, stands tall and punches it past the stumps for a beautifully timed boundary
good length outside off, nipping back in but he lets it go
good length outside off, dabbed down to third man
back of a length at middle, gets on his toes and drops it into the leg side behind square
good length at leg stump, uses soft hands to push it to mid-on and takes off immediately
back of a length in the corridor, back foot defence
good length at off stump, tapped to midwicket off the front foot
good length outside off, turning in sharply, strikes him at middle-and-leg, umpire has given it out and he has reviewed straightaway...and it's a good one. The ball was missing leg stump
tossed up at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
good length at middle stump, goes on the back foot and turns it into the leg side
good length at off stump, hops down the pitch, gets to the pitch and launches the ball - and some pressure - over the long-on boundary
back of a length at middle stump, mistimed pull straight to square leg

good length at off stump, drops it into the off side, there was no run there. It went straight to Santner at covers, AB didn't hesitate and had to put in a dive. It wouldn't have mattered if Santner had hit
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full outside off stump, nails a superb cover drive but it is straight to Santner
bouncer at middle stump, shapes to pull but is content to watch it sail above his left shoulder
bouncer at off stump, tries to get under this and bring out the upper cut, but he's late on it and is beaten
good length outside off, goes down the track and plays an ugly heave. Bat turns in his hand as he gets a top edge, but third man is in the circle so he's safe
good length at off stump, slides in with the angle, forward defence
full at off stump, driven to long-off
good length at middle stump, angles in, he hurriedly makes room and punches off the back foot to cover
good length at middle stump, this time he goes back and uses the angle to pull it over midwicket. AB doesn't want to nudge around
short and wide, slapped straight to cover point
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length at the pads, pushed to midwicket
short outside off, but even on this pitch his pace is not a worry, and Faf comfortably rocks back to pull it to deep square
back of a length at the hips, tucks it to fine leg
attempted slower ball at a length, slides down the leg side
good length at the pads, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
back of a length outside off stump, punched to covers
attempted bouncer is too short and flies well over Faf
good length at off stump, pushed to point off the front foot
good length outside off, pushes forward and taps it to extra cover
back of a length and angled in at off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
good length outside off, tries to repeat AB's shot, beaten
attempted bouncer, too short, flies over the batsman
good length at the pads, turned into the leg side to pick the empty space in front of fine leg and deep square who are teased as they run in
good length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover

he's got him! Bouncer at middle stump, this climbs on him sharply, he's halfway between a duck and a fend, in the end he wants to take his face out of the line and only manages a glove through to the keeper. Superb bouncer from Neesham
good length at middle stump, rolls his fingers on it and gets it to stick in the pitch, hits the shoulder of the bat as he defends
good length at off stump, driven on the up to cover
back of a length at middle stump, he shapes to chop it to third man, but it spits at him from the pitch and he has to negotiate it like someone has thrown a chair at him
back of a length at off stump, punches through the off side but Santner dives to stop the ball rolling to sweeper cover
good length outside off, wild slash at it, thick outside edge flies straight to third man on the bounce
good length at off stump, he nervously pokes at it with one hand and no feet
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
good length at off stump, defended solidly off the front foot
good length at middle stump, defended to mid-on
back of a length in the corridor, rides the bounce and turns it to third man
short and angled across the left-hander, and he bludgeons this on the up through the off side ring, there's no one in the deep
good length, angled at middle stump, he walks at it and tries to whip it through the leg side. Loud appeal, but that pitched outside
back of a length outside off, chopped to third man
back of a length in the corridor, gets behind the line and opens the face to push it to point
back of a length and climbing in the corridor, adjusts last minute to get on top of the bounce and defend
full at off stump, driven towards mid-off, and Boult has never looked more like Ed Norton than now - puts in a dive to his right and catches this bump ball mid-air
bouncer at middle stump, pulled to deep square
good length at off stump, tries to caress this between mid-off and extra cover, can't fine the gap
full at off stump, squeezes out a cover drive and Santner puts in yet another dive in the covers region to offer no runs there
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
bouncer at off stump from around the wicket, flies over the attempted pull shot

good length at off stump, no feet, throws his hands at it and slices uppishly with hard hands and just falls short of Neesham's left hand at point. In fact it slides under his left hand and rolls away to the boundary where Santner unleashes a five yard slide only to meet with Brownlie's shins as he runs across from third man - Brownlie executes a classic football dive and tumbles
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, waits for it and chops it to third man
good length at off stump, hardly a stride in as he fends at this and pushes into the off side
tossed up outside off, in his slot, brings out the full hitting arc and slams this over the bowler and into the sight screen. Too easy for him
good length, fired down the leg side, he rolls his wrists on this and tickles it fine
good length at middle stump, pushed into the off side
full at leg stump, driven to long-on
good length at the pads, nudged to short fine
full at the pads, flicked to deep square leg
full outside off, slower ball, driven to mid-off
short and at the hips, tucks it out from his mid-riff to fine leg as he turns
back of a length, angled in at off stump from around the wicket, punched to short covers
bouncer at his body, too fast for his attempted hook, he's not even through half of it and that's why it lands well in front of deep square
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
good bouncer. Climbs at his head, and this time he knows he's late on this and drops his wrists
full slower ball outside off, he's not to the pitch but he powers through it anyway and it flies to mid-off's left
back of a length outside off, tapped to point
short and wide, sits up nicely and creams it on the up past cover point
back of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
good length at middle stump, defended off the front foot
good length at leg stump, turned down to fine leg
back of a length outside off, runs it down to third man
short at off stump, short-arm jab, on the bounce to short midwicket
geez. Butchered? Slaughtered? Hammered? Could be any one of those. Back of a length outside off, gives him the charge and flat-bats it past his boot
and now he shows the next version - steps out again, flat-bats again, this time goes aerial and slams the sight screen flat
back of a length at middle stump, defended to short midwicket
back of a length outside off, after a lot of scrapping around, du Plessis finally has the field in and he punches this beautifully off the back foot to bisect point and cover
good length at off stump from around the wicket, defended off the back foot
full at off stump, punched to mid-off
back of a length, angled into the corridor, squeezes it out to third man
yorker at leg stump, pushed to mid-on
bouncer at off stump, fends at it awkwardly, but it lands safely
good length at off stump, pushed to covers
back of a length at middle stump, goes back and tucks it into the leg side
tosses it up liberally outside off from around, well wide from Miller's arc and he gets the bottom of the bat  as he goes for the slog sweep. Rolls down to long-on
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
good length at middle, it's an arm ball and it  slides back to catch him on the pads, bowler appeals, going down leg

dropped! Short at middle stump, tries to finish this game with a pull shot. Goes with hard hands, gets a top edge to fine leg. Patel runs in, but slows down towards the end and he has to therefore go low to try and catch it - too low, no catch

a classy shot to bring up the series win and retain No.1 on the rankings. Short ball at off stump from around the wicket, he hangs back with all the composure he's shown today and pulls it in front of square with disdain. That was a leader's innings, and it will show as his 26th half-century
